intro: Rhodognaphalon lukayense, commonly known as the Lukayense Caper. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Capparaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and succulent leaves. Native to the mountainous regions of Eastern Africa, it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are used in local cuisines. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
